alert.note: Alert for Morgan (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 9:12PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Washington, southeastern Morgan and east central Athens Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 912 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Chesterhill, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Beverly, Chesterhill, Williamstown, Boaz, Lowell, Stockport, Macksburg, Amesville, Lower Salem, Hackney, Fleming, Bartlett and Devola. This includes Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 1 and 17. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to travel across flooded roads. Find alternate routes. It takes only a few inches of swiftly flowing water to carry vehicles away. Do not drive your vehicle into areas where the water covers the roadway. The water depth may be too great to allow your car to cross safely. Move to higher ground.
